thread.title: Portugal's Alentejo is transformed for The Flower's Festival with floral canopies
thread.title_full: Portugal's Alentejo is transformed for The Flower's Festival with floral canopies | Daily Mail Online

author: Becky Pemberton For Mailonline
title: Portugal's Alentejo is transformed for The Flower's Festival with floral canopies
text:
4.8k shares 4
View
comments
It's an amazing way of brightening up the streets - but it's extremely labour intensive.
The Flower's Festival, in Campo Maior in the heart of Portugal's Alentejo, is a sea of thousands of delicate petals in every colour and pattern as far as the eye can see.
The amount of work that goes into this multicoloured display is staggering, as each petal is handmade. In all 30 tonnes of material is transformed by 7,500 volunteers.
After the date is decided upon, the community makes each individual petal and design the rainbow walkways.
Tourists can stroll under flower canopies illuminated by enchanting hanging lanterns.
The display, also known as People’s Festival, streams through the streets of the city until August 30.
The Flower's Festival in the heart of Portugal's Alentejo is a sea of thousands of delicate petals in every colour and pattern as far as the eye can see
But what's really impressive about this multicoloured display is the staggering amount of work that goes into its creation... as each petal is handmade

After the date is decided upon, the community get set to make each individual petal and design the rainbow walkways
No easy feat: Last year the festival used a staggering 30 tons of material and 7,500 volunteer people
The last Festas do Povo took place in 2011 and brought about one million tourists to the area who marvelled at the display
An orange sea: One of the many streets is bedecked in row upon row of orange petals, attached together
Turquoise haven: Tourists marvel at the stunning walkway canapies that line the streets of Alentejo
Tourists can stroll under flower canopies illuminated by enchanting hanging lanterns that dangle from above
After the date is decided upon, the community makes each individual petal and design the rainbow walkways
Don't miss out: The display, also known as People’s Festival, streams through the streets of the city until August 30
